title: Introduction to Digital Marketing
note: This section provides a formal definition of Digital Marketing as the component of marketing that uses the Internet and online-based digital technologies to promote products and services. It contrasts digital marketing with traditional marketing (like print or TV ads), highlighting its advantages in reach, targeting, and measurability.

title: The Marketing Funnel
note: This lesson introduces the Marketing Funnel, a core model for understanding the customer journey. It explains the typical stages: Awareness (attracting new audiences), Consideration (engaging prospects), Conversion (turning prospects into customers), and Loyalty/Advocacy (retaining existing customers).

title: Core Channel: Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
note: This section introduces SEO as the practice of increasing the quantity and quality of traffic to your website through organic (non-paid) search engine results. It explains the fundamental goal of SEO: to be the most relevant result for a user's search query.

title: How Search Engines Work
note: This lesson provides a high-level overview of how search engines like Google work. It explains the three main processes: Crawling (discovering pages on the web), Indexing (storing and organizing the content of those pages), and Ranking (deciding which pages are most relevant to a search query).

title: SEO: On-Page SEO
note: This section covers On-Page SEO, which refers to the practice of optimizing individual web pages to rank higher. It details key elements, including conducting keyword research, writing effective title tags and meta descriptions, using proper headings (H1, H2), and creating high-quality, relevant content.

title: SEO: Off-Page SEO
note: This lesson explains Off-Page SEO, which involves actions taken outside of your own website to impact your rankings. It focuses on the concept of 'backlinks' (links from other websites to yours) as a primary signal of authority and trust to search engines.

title: Core Channel: Search Engine Marketing (SEM)
note: This section introduces SEM as the practice of marketing a business using paid advertisements that appear on search engine results pages. It explains the Pay-Per-Click (PPC) model, where advertisers pay a fee each time one of their ads is clicked. Google Ads is presented as the most popular SEM platform.

title: Understanding a PPC Auction
note: This lesson explains how platforms like Google Ads determine which ads to show. It introduces the concept of the Ad Auction, which is not just based on the highest bid. It explains that Ad Rank is determined by a combination of the advertiser's bid and their Quality Score (a measure of ad relevance and landing page quality).

title: Core Channel: Content Marketing
note: This section defines Content Marketing as a strategic marketing approach focused on creating and distributing valuable, relevant, and consistent content to attract and retain a clearly defined audience. The goal is to drive profitable customer action by providing useful information rather than direct sales pitches.

title: Types of Content
note: This lesson explores the various formats that content marketing can take. It covers blog posts and articles for SEO, videos for engagement, infographics for data visualization, lead magnets like e-books and whitepapers for lead generation, and webinars for interactive presentations.

title: Core Channel: Social Media Marketing (SMM)
note: This lesson introduces SMM as the use of social media platforms to connect with your audience to build your brand, increase sales, and drive website traffic. It emphasizes the importance of choosing the right platforms based on where your target audience spends their time.

title: Organic vs. Paid Social Media
note: This section contrasts the two main approaches to SMM. Organic social media involves building a community and sharing content without paying for promotion. Paid social media involves running targeted ad campaigns to reach specific demographics and interests, which is crucial for reaching new audiences.

title: Core Channel: Email Marketing
note: This lesson explains Email Marketing as the act of sending a commercial message, typically to a group of people, using email. It is a highly effective channel for nurturing leads and retaining customers because you are communicating with an audience that has explicitly opted in to hear from you.

title: Building an Email List
note: This section covers the crucial first step of email marketing: building a subscriber list. It emphasizes ethical practices, such as using lead magnets and clear sign-up forms, and warns against the ineffectiveness and legal risks of buying email lists.

title: Crafting an Effective Email Campaign
note: This lesson details the components of a successful email. It covers writing compelling subject lines to increase open rates, crafting clear and concise body copy with a single call-to-action (CTA), and the importance of A/B testing different elements to optimize performance.

title: Introduction to Digital Marketing Analytics
note: This section introduces the practice of measuring, managing, and analyzing marketing performance to maximize its effectiveness. It emphasizes the importance of using data, not intuition, to make marketing decisions. Google Analytics is presented as the standard tool for web analytics.

title: Key Metrics to Track
note: This lesson defines some of the most important metrics in digital marketing. It covers Traffic (how many users visit your site), Bounce Rate (the percentage of visitors who leave after viewing only one page), Conversion Rate (the percentage of users who take a desired action), and Cost Per Acquisition (CPA).

title: Developing a Digital Marketing Plan
note: This final lesson provides a framework for creating a cohesive digital marketing strategy. It covers the essential steps: setting SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound) goals, defining your target audience and buyer personas, conducting a competitive analysis, choosing your channels, and setting a budget.
